website_summaries.verdict: Versatile workout gear that fits comfortably for most and performs above expectations.
pros: This strap will enhance the at-home workout
Effective for ground-based core exercise as well as with chin-up bars and extension routines
Reviews highlight the nylon fabric's durability
Comes with two ab straps, quick-connect steel carabiners and downloadable online workout
cons: May experience wear when bearing extreme weight

customer_reviews.title: Unsafe
customer_reviews.text: Item is unsafe and potentially dangerous. Worked fine for a couple of workouts but then one of the straps tore (see attached picture). I weigh 175lbs, maybe this will work for someone who is significantly lighter.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable and durable Ab straps
customer_reviews.text: Well designed product, Rey happy so far. I have been using this product over a month now and I am happy with it. Only recommendation I have to the manufacturer is that replace the carabiner with a version that is not sharp or catchy. Every time I detach from my gym equipment I noticed the carabiner catches the nylon strap and in the long run this will frey the nylon strap. Overall I would recommend this product as everything else about it is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Shana

customer_reviews.title: Very nice, slightly shorter straps is an advantage
customer_reviews.text: Very nice overall. These are a fair bit smaller than other ab straps I've used, and because of that I find them superior. Because they are shorter I can put my hands on the pull up bar they are hanging off of and it makes my ab raises much more secure, and puts much less pressure on my armpits. They are sturdy and stand up to my workout of 50 straight leg raises, followed by knee raises and side raises. After months of using them the stitching has held tight.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, durable and all around great buy
customer_reviews.text: Been using these for about a month and they are great. I’m really picky when it comes to these because they are usually uncomfortable, irritate or pinch. These are super comfortable and feel really sturdy. I’m 180, 5’11 and use these almost every other day. The straps don’t scratch the bars and the angle of them I thought would be off off but once you put your arms in they straighten out nicely.
customer_reviews.author: benny martinez

customer_reviews.title: Good..if you’re light weight and won’t use for more than three years.
customer_reviews.text: It was good while it lasted. I’ve owned for a few years but had only used them about 20 times. It should be noted that I’m 200lbs but I was doing static workouts with no swinging. With that said I may be over capacity but I didn’t see any weight limit in the description. Both straps broke at the same time (I know what are the chances) causing me to land on my back. Luckily I had a thin pad under me. I’ll be buying a heavier duty set next time.
customer_reviews.author: arich

customer_reviews.title: Nice addition to a pull up bar for more ab work
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to go with the Perfect Pullup Bar basic -- this is the kind of pullup bar that mounts inside the doorway with screws. They work really well and would go with any similar type pullup bar. (not sure they would work with the kind of bar that goes over the door frame) Padded sleeves with a strap that goes over the bar and attaches to a loop via a spring ring. These add a whole new level of work out to the pullup bar with the various leg lifts, twists, pikes, etc. that really work the core. They seem to be made well -- heavy stitching, metal ring clips -- been getting good use from them
customer_reviews.author: S. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Really helps  alleviate my chronic back pain.
customer_reviews.text: These are very useful attachments to use in conjunction with Perfect Ab’s chin-up bar. I have a bad lower back due to disc wear, and any type of traditional abdominal exercise was simply to painful. I’m a little skeptical of in-home exercise gadgets, but once I used these tricep supports to isolate the abdomen, I found that while targeting my waist, they provided an incredible amount of relief from back pain, due no doubt to stretching the spine a bit. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Mac

customer_reviews.title: Nice little ab workout
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect for hanging over the pullup bar and working on abs without exhausting grip strength. There is a little bit of a learning curve, and getting stronger shoulders makes them easier to use for sure. I suggest looking at the workout plans they have in the box, and starting there. Basically, you hang these up, put your arms in them (engage your shoulders, you don't want to shlump), and then lift your legs using your abs. You can do bent knees to chest, bent knees lifted to either side, or even do these directions with straight legs which is more difficult. I can feel my abs and shoulders burning after a session with these straps!
customer_reviews.author: Molly

customer_reviews.title: Good sturdy quality, does the job, but....
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy, high quality pads for my lightweight body, however, I dont personally care for all the grey strapping. Since I often remove these from my bar, and then re-apply, they kind of get tangled in twists and turns when I go to put them back on. These were my 1st pair, but in the future, if these ever wear out, I will likely buy a different style. I also didn't care for the "too heavy" carabiners. I went to Lowes and bought some smaller, lightweight ones. Still, this does the job it was designed to do, and they 'are' quality.
customer_reviews.author: DANDT

customer_reviews.title: These are great..
customer_reviews.text: These are great... Comfy and they go on and off your bar very quickly... I super recommend that (if you use any of these type straps) you should cut off some big, cotton tube socks and slide them up high on your arms. If you hang on them long enough, they all dig a little into your arm pits... These are the most comfortable ones I've ever used though.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Newman

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I have these on the top of my smith machine for leg raises. At 230lb I find these comfortable to use as the pad for your upper arms is quite long and disperses the pressure evenly. They are lightweight but feel like they are made of good quality sturdy material. A really cost effective way to add another dimension to your home gym.
customer_reviews.author: MickSD77

customer_reviews.title: Cut off circulation
customer_reviews.text: This might be me and not the equipment but I’m going to rate it this way regardless. These are not comfortable under the arms and cut off circulation. This prevents me from doing more, or alternating with an arm exercise because my arms need to recover between sets. They seem safe but are not really usable. The ones I had used at the gym a while back seemed fine but I am getting older... I’m 6’2 and 180lbs.
customer_reviews.author: SeanStL

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable and cause burns on triceps
customer_reviews.text: They kind of work, but are cheap and uncomfortable. The padding is non-existent and is pretty much nylon fabric/stitching rubbing against your triceps with each rep. I added a hand towel in each one for padding so I don't get rash burns on my arms and the towels move around so it messes up my concentration and workout. Recommend spending the extra $10-20 for a better setup rather than wasting time/money on these.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Jones

customer_reviews.title: new addition to my home gym
customer_reviews.text: I saw similar item at my local gym and found it very useful for abs exercise. I live in a duplex with round stairs so I was able to just hook it up on the stairs to do leg lifts. There are many similar products out there so not sure how this would compare and/or stand out. It does what it says in the description.
customer_reviews.author: Ren

customer_reviews.title: Holds up
customer_reviews.text: I’m 205lbs and these strap hold my weight. These seem rather sturdy when performing my hanging leg raises. Provides much more comfort and stability while performing such exercises, in opposed to hanging by my hands, which I find to be uncomfortable and more difficult.
customer_reviews.author: S.S

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Ab Isolation Exercises!
customer_reviews.text: No more hand/elbow cramps from hanging leg lifts! Also a good way to stretch your spine with minimal tension on your hips/arms. Nylon seems to be good quality and same with the clips. If it ends up ripping, I'll update this review, but so far so good! I use these straps 3 times a week for about ~7 minutes each time.
customer_reviews.author: imyourpal

customer_reviews.title: Great item
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable to place arms on. Setting it up takes like two seconds, and the material is woven pretty securely. Doesn't look like it'll cheap out and rip on me. Great core workout. I do find myself being a bit too tall for the doorway, so the combination of this and my pull up bar kinda forces me to bend my knees slightly to stay off the ground (not that great when doing straight legged leg raises). But great product nonetheless.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Song

customer_reviews.title: These were a great buy for the price
customer_reviews.text: These were a great buy for the price. I weigh 270 and I felt no pressure points on my arms, the weight is distributed nicely across the straps. I also like that they stay in place well, they do not shift side to side at all when you are using them. All of the material seems of high quality and they should last for quite some time.
customer_reviews.author: WagsTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Does what it’s intended for and very sturdy!!
customer_reviews.text: Good durability. Doesn’t feel like it’s going to break once you get in them. I’m 5’10” and weigh 170 lbs. There’s a slight twist that it puts on your arms/shoulders once in place. As you can see from product pictures if you’re looking at it from behind the clips are straight, but the arm holes face outwards. It could be fixed if they had a swivel somewhere above the arm holes so you could be in a straight line as opposed to torquing your arms inward. Otherwise it does what it’s intended for. I’d recommend the product to others.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: seem well made and worth the price. UPDATE!!! DO not buy if you are over 200 lbs. I weigh 241, and the right strap broke completely while i was using it leaving me hanging by my left elbow...as it has two straps each side for a total of 4 straps per arm for my 241 lbs each strap cant even hold 35 lbs without failure. I have owned these for less than a year and they have always been inside. This could have really injured me! has good reviews, but for anyone serious and heavier, spend more money...
customer_reviews.author: jeremy

customer_reviews.title: 1/2 cost of comparable items!
customer_reviews.text: Seller shows initiative in delivery arrival in 1/2 estimated time! These straps are 95% comparable in every way to top brands costing 2x-3x this price. Rugged, durable, yet lightweight; securely supports my 6'4" 285lbs quite well.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Ragland

customer_reviews.title: Could be a little bit longer
customer_reviews.text: Good product and does what it's supposed to do, but I just wish the straps were a bit longer, or perhaps adjustable, because they are rather short for my arms and make my knees-to-bar crunches a bit awkward.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Great for price
customer_reviews.text: These are great for the price however it becomes quite uncomfortable to use after a couple of sessions. I may be gripping it wrong but it makes my arms go numb. However, it could be my form and I still use them every day.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: I like them! They are comfortable enough
customer_reviews.text: So, far? I like them! They are comfortable enough, have not ripped or frayed, I am 215 lbs. I use it nearly every day, One or two leg lifts, each time I walk by and then twice a week to failure. No issues, the pad is not bad and the length is good. Can be knotted, I suppose, to shorten the hang.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: May work for larger hands
customer_reviews.text: The idea of this product is great, but in actuality, the design was not executed correctly. This may work for people with large hands. There is no way to hold the cuff and a bar/barbell at the same time. This put a lot of stress on my hands and wrists. if the cuff was a bit smaller, may be this would work.
customer_reviews.author: Cecilia H. Bynoe

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what i was looking for.
customer_reviews.text: These have been terrific in conjunction with my pull-up bar. very good way to isolate the abs and do lots of different exercises. Just a great way to mix it up from doing ab workouts on the floor or trying to hold yourself up on the pull-up bar so you can really hit what you are trying to work out.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Robesh

customer_reviews.title: Dry Rots
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for a year. Had it alongside my TRX straps, and the material dry rotted and failed resulting in both straps ripping apart. TRX straps are going strong, so the material on these straps is weak. Worked great otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Jive Dude

customer_reviews.title: Requires arms
customer_reviews.text: These are good for your abs, but they definitely require arms to use effectively. I tried hanging by my neck but I just asphyxiated myself. Bad news bears. Overall, an experience I would try again in a different situation, like one with arms.
customer_reviews.author: J. Moody

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: I’m a larger athlete: 6’1” 250lbs and these are to small and uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: CasaMan

customer_reviews.title: Not durable and lack of customer support. Otherwise product worked well.
customer_reviews.text: This product worked great and is comfortable but it was not durable. While I purchase this product a while ago, I did not really use it until recently during CoVID-19. I am about 150 lbs and a light user of the produce but the strap tore while I was using it. I’m a not sure how long this product should last but it falls short of my expectation. I tried to call the vendor multiple times but they do not answer the calls and their voicemail is full and cannot take messages.
customer_reviews.author: Vo C

customer_reviews.title: Poor design leads to movement once placed on your pull-up bar.
customer_reviews.text: When you hook it around your pull-up stand, poles, or whatever, it has a tendency to move the carabiner towards the top. This ultimately makes the supportive areas move sideways, so everytime I step down from using it, I have to re-position the strap and quickly throw my arms in so it doesn't move back out of place.
customer_reviews.author: J. Park

customer_reviews.title: Great straps
customer_reviews.text: I got these to up my ab training routine. My hands were getting fatigued from holding the pull-up bar while trying to work my lower abs. I knew I could perform more reps if it weren't for my hands getting tired. These solved the problem. They are easy to clip/unclip. The price was great too. I should mention that I'm 5'7" and these worked out fine for me.
customer_reviews.author: runner1701

customer_reviews.title: Just long enough
customer_reviews.text: Reviewing on my wife's profile... In their fully extended position, the straps are just shy of the perfect length for me but I make them work. I'm 6'6" so my arms are fairly long. I've been using them for 6 months and they hold just fine with no signs of damage.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE DANGEROUS both straps tore while using it
customer_reviews.text: only 3 years old and both straps just shredded and tore while using it. Luckily I wasn't that far off the ground and did not fall. I'm only 175# and 5'6"
customer_reviews.author: Ran-D

customer_reviews.title: easy set up.
customer_reviews.text: Great for abs, protects your lower back, easy to set up and does not take to much place when traveling. I have tight them together with a rope so you only need one anchor point to hung.
customer_reviews.author: LLonie

customer_reviews.title: These are bad***... i built a pulp ...
customer_reviews.text: These are bad*** ... i built a pulp bar made of black steel in my garage and hung these around the 1" bar... wow!! i used to just hang by hand and perform ab exercises.. these things take all the effort and strain off of your fingers, hands, wrists, shoulders, back, chest, and make you focus all that extra strength you'd be exerting on your abs.
customer_reviews.author: Ky

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: These work as intended. My hands were really hurting on the pull up bar, not allowing me to get my ab reps in. These help tremendously but I do begin to lose feeling in my arms at #30. I've tried mixing the location of my arms/elbows and I always begin to get a tingly sensation towards the end of my counting. Not a big deal.
customer_reviews.author: KylieMomma

customer_reviews.title: I really like these because they are comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I really like these because they are comfortable, well made and snap on and off easily. Some of these types of straps clip onto the bars directly. I was concerned that it may chip the powder coat on the bars after a while. These clip onto themselves making a closed strap over the bars.
customer_reviews.author: REOmike

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for some AB straps that I could easily and quickly fit over an upper bar on a Smith machine. These suited that purpose exactly and at a very inexpensive price and I am quite happy with this. They seem to be made with fairly sturdy construction and I could find no weak points .
customer_reviews.author: M. Galbreath

customer_reviews.title: Buy these now
customer_reviews.text: I have a full weight rack system and tried doing an exercises just by holding the pull up bars...and well it’s really difficult and you can’t do more that 20 at a time max. So I bought these babies to do supersets and they are amazing! You get such a huge burn and they feel super sturdy. Amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Tris Honnes

customer_reviews.title: Abs of steel
customer_reviews.text: Great value, they really do the job. I've made noticeable gains in just a month or so. Not quite as good as a proper captains chair since they put a little more stress on my shoulders. Its important to keep proper form and shoulder tension in order to prevent injury. I do wish the straps were longer, I had to extend mine with cord in order to get it over a support beam. Hard to beat for the price though.
customer_reviews.author: Vaughn Engler

customer_reviews.title: Extremely sturdy, easy to store, great price!
customer_reviews.text: Great product! They are easy to set up and use, extremely sturdy, and easy to store. All at a great price!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley M.

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and effective
customer_reviews.text: Cheap, effective. I wanted these to hit my abs in all the kinds of ways that situps, crunches, etc. just can't. I don't like the kinds of hooks these come with AT ALL. They are extremely difficult to work with and happen to have extremely sharp points that shred the straps each time you hook and unhook them. So, pro tip, buy yourself some nice anodized aluminum carabiners here on Amazon to not only make using these straps more convenient, but also help them last longer.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Otto

customer_reviews.title: Definitely works your core
customer_reviews.text: Nice inexpensive little piece to add to your pull up bar I threw them on to help work my abs and they definitely work even with my 230 pound frame they are well made you can't go wrong with them for sure
customer_reviews.author: bradley jencks

customer_reviews.title: Solid buy
customer_reviews.text: These are great to far! The edges are a little unforgiving, but all straps like this hurt the back of my arms. The short length is nice for increased stabilization. The clips are easy to use. They could be a little more padded, but it's not that big of a deal to me.
customer_reviews.author: Rosie Wood

customer_reviews.title: Great Value! Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: These ab straps are wonderful. They're slightly padded with a soft liner on the inside and the stitching at the seems is doubled up for increased security. The carabiner is made of a decently thick metal with a pretty tuff spring for that added security when you're really putting the hammer down on those leg raises/l-sits. Also it really doesn't matter which way you set them up as they are identical on both sides.
customer_reviews.author: krS

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive but not Cheap
customer_reviews.text: These are decent ab straps, particularly for the price. They could use a little more padding, but they are constructed well and the stitching is good. They are inexpensive but not too cheap. They seem like they should last a long time. I like them and recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Humble Patriot

customer_reviews.title: Durable for various excersizes.
customer_reviews.text: Used for pull downs, as lat exercise, abs excessive, and leg abductor from pullies.
customer_reviews.author: George Piotrowski

customer_reviews.title: Definitely better than buying a full sized rack
customer_reviews.text: I combined this with a door frame chin-up bar in my garage for daily use. Definitely better than buying a full sized rack.
customer_reviews.author: MarcW

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: After a month of use no complaints so far (for a 160lbs person). These seem to be as good a quality as I would ever need.
customer_reviews.author: George B.

customer_reviews.title: Intense ab workout
customer_reviews.text: Very well constructed and comfortable to slip into and workout in. I got a great workout in with these. Try it!
customer_reviews.author: Fiercest Feline 247

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!! Works Well!!
customer_reviews.text: Great Product!! I connected them to my pull up bar and they work great!! Very sturdy and supports my weight easily..
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: Great deal
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these for a week now and absolutely love them! Good price good quality and very useful!
customer_reviews.author: ShayMaySza

customer_reviews.title: Excellent buy
customer_reviews.text: They work great and keep you stable for doing exercises. Good buy for there price. You don’t need to spend more money for this simplistic piece of equipment. I would buy again but I don’t see these wearing out for years.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Great for over door pull up bars, not ceiling mounted bars.
customer_reviews.text: I assume they would work perfectly for pull up bars attached to door frames. I have ceiling mounted pull up bar and these are too short to comfortably get into. It would have been great if they had a longer, adjustable strap.
customer_reviews.author: nai1817

customer_reviews.title: Great straps
customer_reviews.text: Great price, sturdy, durable and a GREAT workout for your abs. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Cee Bee

customer_reviews.title: Like many reviewers have stated before
customer_reviews.text: For the price you really can't demand too much from the product. Like many reviewers have stated before, you might find that the strap is too short. I'm only 5'8" with average forearm length and my hand is just beneath the horizontal bar the straps hang from. Also I'm relatively light weight (under 140 lbs) but the straps will dig in enough to leave a bit of a mark on the back of my arms. For the price I can live with this, but if it's a potential issue for you then consider getting something with with more padding or plan on adding padding yourself.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: it is fine. This is much better than doing sit ups
customer_reviews.text: I had a little trouble with chaffing, the first couple times, but when I focused on not letting my arms slide, it is fine. This is much better than doing sit ups, which my back won't support. Those ab machines and devices didn't work for me. I can feel the muscles tighten. Now if only the belly fat would disappear.
customer_reviews.author: ATom

customer_reviews.title: This was a bad purchase
customer_reviews.text: The hooks are too small for anything... useless as it is.
customer_reviews.author: vance campbell

customer_reviews.title: They work, but the design could be better.
customer_reviews.text: The carabiner is in an awkward place, but I am not sure how to improve it. Overall, it works.
customer_reviews.author: Corrigan

customer_reviews.title: It works.
customer_reviews.text: Had it a short period of time but it seems to work fine. The only drawback is that the straps that support the base are short and not adjustable.
customer_reviews.author: Karma Rash

customer_reviews.title: Solid product, helpful
customer_reviews.text: These were a great addition to my workout routine for adding ab work on an overhead bar. They really allowed me to work my abs until I built up some grip strength and endurance to do the same exercises without them. I don't use them nearly as much now, but at times when I really want to focus purely on my abs and not worry about grip so much, I'll use these.
customer_reviews.author: kismet1113

customer_reviews.title: Perfect addition for my workouts
customer_reviews.text: These were a great purchase for my pull up bar. Lots of great ab workouts.
customer_reviews.author: Chad A Hildebran

customer_reviews.title: Hurts!
customer_reviews.text: Great quality but since they don't stretch or tilt at an angle, as my arms do slightly when using, it is super painful under my bicep area to put most your body weight. I'm returning them because it hurts too much. But maybe that's every brand, not sure. But they are super sturdy!
customer_reviews.author: Jazz

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for getting Abb sessions in before bed or in the AM
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: These are great. Does the job
customer_reviews.text: These are great. Does the job! They just don't look very nice lol, but that doesn't really matter to me
customer_reviews.author: raymond

customer_reviews.title: Ouch!
customer_reviews.text: Awful, you get what you pay for. I've had much better quality straps in the past. These are too short, ( I'm 5'8 female), and they KILL the backs of my arms, very chafing. Am returning and ordering a pair at a higher cost. It'll be worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Amy A.

customer_reviews.title: Works great, I only wish the clips weren't in the ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great, I only wish the clips weren't in the way. I've caught my skin in there once and was cut. I have to position the straps askew in order to avoid that pinch.
customer_reviews.author: Jasmine

customer_reviews.title: These feel high quality/very durable. I do wish the ...
customer_reviews.text: These feel high quality/very durable. I do wish the strap was adjustable so as to allow my son to get into it without having to go on a step stool. We have an over the door chin up bar and you would have to be six foot to get into the straps without a step stool.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love these straps
customer_reviews.text: Love these straps!!! They say in my gym bag. They are perfect for those who don’t quite have a strong grip for ab days!
customer_reviews.author: MadelynnMT

customer_reviews.title: superb
customer_reviews.text: These are wonderful. I've been working out ( push ups, planks, etc. ) but don't have the hand strength to do pull ups. These fit my arms and allow me to work my ads which is my goal. I've been using them in sets of 10 - every other day for about a month and definitely see and feel a difference. Well worth the money. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Diane M. Vicknair

customer_reviews.title: Can't go wrong with these
customer_reviews.text: This is the first time I've used a set of these as I used to use the back-supported-standing-ab-piece of equipment at the gym. When I set up a home gym I still wanted a way to to do a similar exercise. These hanging ab crunches are tougher - better. The straps are plenty strong and the padding is sufficient to be comfortable. I'm very happy with the purchase and think they are priced well.
customer_reviews.author: UTBadger

customer_reviews.title: Work well
customer_reviews.text: These don’t provide as much padding as other straps I’ve used, but who cares? These work well and are very durable.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive and functional
customer_reviews.text: Cool product, inexpensive. My back loves it. I do several exercises with this ab strap. When I use it a lot I do bruise the back of my arm so it's better for me to wear a sweater.
customer_reviews.author: Kristine

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Bargain
customer_reviews.text: Great product for the price! I love them. At the gym, people always ask me to borrow them. "NOPE, sucka! They're cheap enough you can buy your own!" Seriously, these are very comfortable and do exactly what I need them to do. And for the price, I have zero complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Slickflip

customer_reviews.title: An honest, real review!
customer_reviews.text: These straps work great on my exercise cage. The cage has handles to grab onto but I don't have the hand strength to hold on long enough to do my exercises, like hanging leg raises. These straps allow me to do those exercises with no problems at all. I'm a 5'2", 130 lb female and have never been concerned with these straps holding my weight. The straps are very durable. I would definitely recommend these straps.
customer_reviews.author: Bendyprissy

customer_reviews.title: Well manufactured.  sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: Well made, no complaints so far. These were able to support me (155 lbs) well and while I haven't used them as much as I'd like, they seem to do the job just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Ramze

customer_reviews.title: they don't really sit right on pull-up bars,
customer_reviews.text: they don't really sit right on pull-up bars, and you will have to wrap it around a few times to keep your feet from touching the ground
customer_reviews.author: Richard Li

customer_reviews.title: to bad I could't returned it
customer_reviews.text: not to crazy about those, Im 135 b and ended all bruised up on my arms after using this, to bad I could't returned it. they are well made, good quality and seem very durable, but the idea is not so good if you end up with bruises
customer_reviews.author: E. Zuluaga

customer_reviews.title: This targets my lower abs like crazy. I have been working out for years
customer_reviews.text: This targets my lower abs like crazy. I have been working out for years, but nothing destroys my abs like these straps!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and work great
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure how easy these would be to get your arms in and use. They couldn't be easier to install and they are comfortable and very easy to use. They are also very effective. Just a few sets and you will feel the burn in your lower belly. A very good product for the money and they are much more comfortable than the ones that came with my pull up bar. Would recommend to anyone looking for ab straps.
customer_reviews.author: gwalker01

customer_reviews.title: Ab Workout
customer_reviews.text: Great device to assist you in reaching unassisted leg raises, or for those who haven't the grip strength to hold on through a longer workout routine.
customer_reviews.author: clayton A.

customer_reviews.title: have now for few months and they are like new, very strong and stable when use it
customer_reviews.text: I was scare before I purchase this straps cuz usually straps tear with just multiple use , have now for few months and they are like new , very strong and stable when use it , my wt. is 165 lb and ht. 5.7 so it's perfect for me , donts know about heavier and taller guys !
customer_reviews.author: Eric Ali

customer_reviews.title: Good for back stretching
customer_reviews.text: Works well for my back stretching exercises when used with pull-up bar. 1/3 the cost of "back stretcher" advertised here. Requires some upper body strength to use.
customer_reviews.author: Lee S

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: I used it with my iron gym pull up bar and it works great. Feels sturdy, no issues so far.
customer_reviews.author: Pablo

customer_reviews.title: Get your core in shape
customer_reviews.text: I hang these from a chin up bar in a door frame. Way better than doing sit ups, which stress my upper back.
customer_reviews.author: John Yurgil

customer_reviews.title: Help you really isolate your abs ... but you still have to do the hard part :|
customer_reviews.text: They are good... nice and strong ... pretty comfortable (i always put a towel in these type of straps anyway, for extra comfort, and to keep the armpits off of them so they stay clean) ... now, if i could just figure out a way to have them work out my abs if I lay them across my stomach while sleeping, they'd get 10 stars! :)
customer_reviews.author: Trader D

customer_reviews.title: Budget friendly
customer_reviews.text: These suit my needs for my home gym. I definitely would not be using these in a commercial gym though as the material is suitable for individuals with normal daily use. Repeated daily use by multiple people would likely wear these down rather quickly. Great product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: LiftingDad

customer_reviews.title: ... in my basement home gym and this product works great with my Valor BD-7 power cage
customer_reviews.text: I have limited headroom in my basement home gym and this product works great with my Valor BD-7 power cage. A dumbbell between the feet makes ab exercises a little more challenging. This product eliminated the need for an extra piece of equipment. I weight 215 lbs. and the straps have held up so far.
customer_reviews.author: James G.

customer_reviews.title: Good value and quality, wish some minor improvements could be made.
customer_reviews.text: Good price for Ab Straps. Can hold my body weight on my pull up bar - works well even if not same brand. Downside is the looks aren't easy or comfortable to hold on to when using the straps. maybe a modifcation could be done with a padding to make it more comfortable and less irritating to your hands.
customer_reviews.author: NJ Guy

customer_reviews.title: but they hold me up fine and all of the stitching is still intact
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical about the material since I weigh 255 pounds. but they hold me up fine and all of the stitching is still intact.
customer_reviews.author: Omar

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: They are good. Could use a little extra padding. Could have an option of longer straps. But good quality. I improvised to make the straps longer.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.text: Wish they had different sixing options.. too big for my arms
customer_reviews.author: tara berry

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable to use and durable. Now it's part of my regular abs routine.
customer_reviews.author: RADAI CINTRON

customer_reviews.title: The Perfect Ab strap
customer_reviews.text: The perfect abs was just as advertised and my order was delivered earlier than estimated.
customer_reviews.author: Go Time

customer_reviews.title: Feels sturdy and doesn't bite into the arms at all
customer_reviews.text: Works as intended. Feels sturdy and doesn't bite into the arms at all. Great change of pace and much more challenging than doing floor sit ups. Much more intense. Highly recommended, but you need to have a pull up bar to attach it to.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Dunham

customer_reviews.title: very happy.
customer_reviews.text: These work exactly as expected and even came with some exercise tips. Overall, very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: These work great and are very sturdy. They even work really well on my short power cage (72"), which I was afraid would not be the case.
customer_reviews.author: J. Rustles

customer_reviews.title: Great for abs, stay off the floor!
customer_reviews.text: Having back problems for most of my life it's very hard for me to get down on the floor and do crunches or situps. These take all of the pressure off of your lower back and neck. I have my 6 pack back and an 8 is starting to pop out!
customer_reviews.author: Searick1

customer_reviews.title: Love 'em
customer_reviews.text: They're awesome. I'm 200 pounds and these do the trick without issue. They are used with my pull-up bar which hangs on my door frame. Love 'em.
customer_reviews.author: DK

product_meta.title: Perfect Fitness Ab Straps
product_meta.description: Quick-connect a pair of heavy duty performance Abs Straps to your Perfect Pull-up bar or any standard pull-up bar for abs-defining workouts the way the pros do it. Experienced professionals use Abs Straps to perform off-the-floor crunches and leg lifts. Perfect Abs Straps are sturdy, comfortable and designed for years of performance. Made with heavy-duty nylon straps and mountaineering-grade steel carabineers. Extra comfortable - cushioned with thick foam padding.
feature_bullets: Attach to any pull-up bar or Multi-Gym
Heavy-duty construction with steel carabineer and rip-resistant fabric
Includes: 2 deluxe Abs Straps, quick-connect steel carabineers, downloadable online workout
